title: Poor Teemo

Let's see. We're going to let Vayne disappear and roll all over the place and erase people  yet any character whatsoever need only place a control ward to disable Teemo's ult.  Yeah that's fair.

Definitely agreed; however, Teemo needs help in other parts of his kit other than damage really as that's all he has at this point of time. With his shrooms being so easily disabled, it makes quite an impact on the champion as so much of his power is stored within those shrooms. With his laning phase also being really strong - I think Teemo would benefit more from better utility in his kit as opposed to buffing his shrooms or base damage really.

Teemo is meant to be a lane bully; however, his mobility is laughable and he's quite simple to gank in the earlier levels (and even later levels if the Teemo player doesn't position shrooms accordingly to protect themselves). Right now, he's lost a lot of his map control niche ever since his shroom timers went down to 5 minutes and the extra vision tools just make his shrooms even less reliable. Do they need counters? Definitely. However, at the same time - Teemo provides very little else to his team as his range is low even as a marksman.

Perhaps the idea with the tracks could help Teemo get a new niche to help out his team as seen by another highly rated topic on the gameplay board this week. I feel his W really could be better as Teemo barely represents much as a scout and is hardly swift to boot either considering his weak form of escape. Regardless - Teemo really doesn't need more damage at all...but he needs more utility to bring to his team as right now, the shrooms are pretty much his main form of defense and damage after laning phase for AP Teemo players.

Indeed Riot sees Teemo's kit as iconic; however, perhaps an Alistar-level rework for little Teemo can help him out to bring some fresh new mechanics to his kit. Ryze received plenty of reworks...would be nice to have Teemo get a proper rework to give him more reliable utility to his team as right now, Quinn can do his job, but better in the top lane and even as a scout as well.

Git dunked rat, could still use sweeper instead of control ward. And stay dunked.

When Teemo's kit becomes less frustratingly uninteractive, we can talk buffs.

But as long as his entire shtick is to nuke people (rarely kill) with almost no counter-play and often without even being anywhere nearby (shrooms), I am personally in full favor of him being nonviable.

Satan needs a rework more than anything,

I doubt it's an issue about buffing Teemo's damage as he already has plenty of that. Rather, it's more or less the utility he brings comapred to other champions. His ult stores so much damage that the rest of his kit just lacks utility for his team and with more vision tools, that means the shrooms are less reliable than ever. 

Shrooms definitely need counterplay; however, perhaps Teemo's aged kit can allow some additional utility such as scouting information via tracks or whatnot to assist his team better as the map control days he used to have are long gone.

I'm not talking just damage buffs.
Teemo's kit is designed around the ideas of hit-and-run (Q+DoT+speed buff), ambush (Passive), and booby traps (Shrooms). The common thread behind these components is agency. Rather, that the opponent has ***none***. Teemo's kit is designed to minimize counter-play, which is why he is so frustrating to deal with and can't be strong. He has all the fun of dodging invisible Nid Spears.

I'm all for Teemo getting power moved into utility (Utility is *always* a great thing to have), but his kit as a whole needs to be reevaluated.

*(Bring on the down-votes.)*

No, you bring up a good point and as one who loves Teemo's character a lot personally - I agree with your points as well as I agree that the character has a ton of flaws as well. Teemo's kit is definitely very unhealthy and that's why counters to his shrooms via vision items are needed regardless - though the point of how much damage he has in his ult is why so many are concerned as to how the coontrol wards are disabling his ult as well.

However, you're right that Teemo's fantasy should always be the hit and run type though it seems that Riot is afraid to rework his kit due to how "iconic" it is seen as. Definitely think seeing some power shifted into more utility would help him become a better character in general for teams and a potential rework might do some wonders to possibly make him less frustrating to lane against as well. Right now, his kit is reminiscent of the many older champs who got reworked as a result of their lack of counterplay as well - though Teemo has survived so far without getting much reworks to his kit. It's about time he got some changes to make him a better champion for any team.
